definitions.definition: To creep ; to move slowly on hands and knees , or by dragging the body along the ground .
examples: Clutching my wounded side, I crawled back to the trench.

definitions.definition: To move forward slowly, with frequent stops.
examples: The rush-hour traffic crawled around the bypass.

definitions.definition: To act in a servile manner.
examples: Don’t come crawling to me with your useless apologies!

definitions.definition: Followed by with : see crawl with .

examples: The horrible sight made my skin crawl .

definitions.definition: To swim using the crawl stroke .
examples: I think I’ll crawl the next hundred metres.

definitions.definition: To move over (an area) on hands and knees.
examples: The baby crawled the entire second floor.

definitions.definition: To move over (an area) slowly, with frequent stops.
To visit files or web sites in order to index them for searching .
examples: Yahoo Search has updated its Slurp Crawler to crawl websites faster and more efficiently.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To creep ; to move slowly on hands and knees , or by dragging the body along the ground .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To move forward slowly, with frequent stops.
( intransitive ) To act in a servile manner.
( intransitive ) Followed by with : see crawl with .
( intransitive ) To feel a swarming sensation.
( intransitive , transitive ) To swim using the crawl stroke .
( transitive ) To move over (an area) on hands and knees.
( transitive ) To move over (an area) slowly, with frequent stops.
( transitive , Internet ) To visit files or web sites in order to index them for searching .
